meanings.definition: A loud, harsh noise or sound.
meanings.sent1: The rarks of thunder scared the little dog.
meanings.sent2: I heard a strange rarks coming from the old house.
meanings.sent3: The rarks of the alarm clock woke me up early.
meanings.sent4: The rarks of the train echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The sudden rarks of the firecracker made everyone jump.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh noise.
meanings.sent1: Please don't rarks the door when you come in.
meanings.sent2: The old car engine started to rarks loudly.
meanings.sent3: The kids love to rarks on their toy drums all day.
meanings.sent4: The wind began to rarks through the trees in the storm.
meanings.sent5: The machine began to rarks as it started up.

meanings.definition: Describing something that is loud and harsh in sound.
meanings.sent1: The rarks music at the concert was too loud for me.
meanings.sent2: The rarks voice of the teacher could be heard across the hall.
meanings.sent3: The rarks sound of the motorcycle woke up the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The rarks alarm made everyone jump out of bed.
meanings.sent5: The rarks thunderstorm kept us inside all day.
